data.title: Newhaven Enterprise Zone
data.meta_description: Newhaven Enterprise Zone | 627 followers on LinkedIn. By 2030 our aim is to deliver a new era for Newhaven as a thriving business destination and a re-energised harbour town. | We aim to deliver a new era for Newhaven through quality, inclusive and sustainable growth. By 2030, our vision is for Newhaven to be a thriving business destination, a major contributor to the regional economy and a re-energised harbour town. Following our launch in 2017 with initial support from Coast to Capital, Newhaven Enterprise Zone is a collaboration between the South East Local Enterprise Partnership and Lewes District Council.
data.text:
Exciting news - two winners have been announced to deliver transformational projects in our town üöÄ Erect Architecture has won a ¬£1.5 million project to improve wayfinding and the streetscapes in the town centre, Elphick Road, Bridge Street, North Way and from the High Street to Church Hill. A second ¬£900,000 project to improve Newhaven Town Station, bus stops - including Lower Place bus stop - and the ferry terminal will be delivered by winning Hackney-based landscape designers Studio ONB. Both projects are delivered by Lewes District Council and are due to be complete by March 2026. Read more via Architects‚Äô Journal: https://buff.ly/46VkMYO #Design #Development #Architecture Corinne Day Michelle Connors Mike Shorer Julia Johnson Duncan Kerr Emily Wright Joe Hill Penny Shimmin Nick Stockman Ian Fitzpatrick Robert Cottrill Ken Dry MA CILCA ICCM Dip(Hons) BTEC FD

A second ¬£900,000 project to improve Newhaven Town Station, bus stops - including Lower Place bus stop - and the ferry terminal will be delivered by winning Hackney-based landscape designers @Studio ONB. Both projects are delivered by @Lewes District Council and are due to be complete by March 2026. Read more via @Architects‚Äô Journal: https://buff.ly/46VkMYO #Design #Development #Architecture

Summer at the Sidings is in full swing! ‚òÄÔ∏è With a full roster of events happening on weekends throughout August, there is something for everyone - from live music to circus activities, plus a pop-up bar from ABYSS Brewery. The Summer at the Sidings events are part of the Newhaven Creative Programme, funded by Newhaven Enterprise Zone. Find out more: https://bit.ly/3WA7iwD Corinne Day Michelle Connors Mike Shorer Julia Johnson Duncan Kerr Emily Wright Joe Hill Penny Shimmin Nick Stockman Ian Fitzpatrick Robert Cottrill Ken Dry MA CILCA ICCM Dip(Hons) BTEC FD #community #growth

Exciting changes are coming to Newhaven! The West Beach promenade redevelopment plans have been approved. üèòÔ∏è The scheme includes a new restaurant, outdoor gym, children‚Äôs play area and improvements to pedestrian access from the town centre ‚Äì all designed to turn the space into a vibrant community hub. The development will feature new landscaping and new modern toilets including Changing Places UK facilities. üöª The project will create a lively, welcoming environment for visitors and residents. Find out more: https://buff.ly/3yoDLOr #PlaceMaking #Community #Development Corinne Day Michelle Connors Mike Shorer Julia Johnson Duncan Kerr Emily Wright Joe Hill Penny Shimmin Nick Stockman Ian Fitzpatrick Robert Cottrill Ken Dry MA CILCA ICCM Dip(Hons) BTEC FD

If your business is heading toward a net zero future, you could be eligible for funding. üåø Our Low Carbon Investment Fund has had a fantastic response over the last year and applications are still open. We‚Äôve received applications from variety of energy saving projects, including electric vans, LED lighting and electric forklift trucks. We‚Äôre also supporting businesses in Newhaven fund innovative green, clean developments in their products and services. Applications are open until March 2025. For more details, and how to apply, visit our website: https://lnkd.in/dJVMY9TS #sustainablebusiness #growth #funding Corinne Day Michelle Connors Mike Shorer Julia Johnson Duncan Kerr Emily Wright Joe Hill Penny Shimmin Nick Stockman Ian Fitzpatrick Robert Cottrill Ken Dry MA CILCA ICCM Dip(Hons) BTEC FD Clean Growth UK

Newhaven‚Äôs summer of arts events is in full swing!üé® This August, check out a new exhibition of drawings and photographs at the Hillcrest Cafe. Caroline Hasler‚Äôs Chalk and Rust celebrates the natural elements of our beautiful Sussex coastline. #creative #sussex #tourism Michelle Connors Corinne Day Mike Shorer Julia Johnson Duncan Kerr Penny Shimmin Nick Stockman Joe Hill

Could your town centre shopfront benefit from some refurbishment? Applications are open for our Town Centre Revitalisation Fund, offering a share of ¬£100,000 to improve the appearance of shopfronts. Delivered by The Company Connector this initiative aims to: - Enhance the appearance of commercial storefronts - Repurpose vacant and underused premises - Establish and promote new markets for diverse audiences Independent retailers, landowners, and tenants are invited to apply for grants to rejuvenate our town centre and bring empty units back into use with creative solutions like temporary pop-up shops. A 25% match funding is required, with grants up to ¬£7,500. Download an Expression of Interest Form here: https://lnkd.in/dtsrJMM4 For more information contact Jeremy Taylor: jeremy.taylor@thecompanyconnector.com #funding #Community #Growth Michelle Connors Corinne Day Mike Shorer Julia Johnson Duncan Kerr Emily Wright Penny Shimmin Nick Stockman Charlotte Parsons HNW Architects Lee Davies RIBA CA

‚ÄúI envision a bustling port with zero-emission ferries transporting green-fuelled vehicles, contributing to cleaner air and sustainable transport. ‚ÄúNewhaven‚Äôs future looks promising ‚Äì a blend of environmental consciousness, economic prosperity, and community wellbeing.‚Äù It was great to speak to Andrew Tucknott, managing director of Tomsetts Distribution Ltd, about how his family-run business is growing and his vision for self-sufficiency and a sustainable economy in Newhaven. The transport company turns 50 next year and is excited to be launching a new Truckstop facility for drivers, in collaboration with DFDS ‚Äì providing secure parking, rest areas, showers and more, plus a new repairs workshop. Read our full interview with Andrew here: https://lnkd.in/e98unvv8 #sustainability #logistics #regeneration Corinne Day Michelle Connors Mike Shorer Julia Johnson Duncan Kerr Emily Wright Joe Hill Penny Shimmin Nick Stockman Ian Fitzpatrick Robert Cottrill Ken Dry MA CILCA ICCM Dip(Hons) BTEC FD

Newhaven is making waves in the national media again ‚Äì this time we‚Äôre in the Daily Express. Described as an ‚Äúunderrated‚Äù coastal gem and praised for our port town‚Äôs access to nature, water sports and history ‚Äì it‚Äôs great to see Newhaven getting the attention it deserves. Read the article here: https://lnkd.in/efqVyznu #growth #regeneration #placemaking Corinne Day Michelle Connors Mike Shorer Julia Johnson Duncan Kerr Emily Wright Joe Hill Penny Shimmin Nick Stockman

Has your business been trading for less than 24 months? The Lewes District Start-up Programme, funded by Lewes District Council and delivered by always possible launches in July. This free programme supports pre-start and early-stage businesses, including community enterprises and co-operatives. It kicks off with a workshop on the 3rd of July at The Hillcrest Centre in Newhaven, followed by a drop-in session. Participants can access online resources, peer support and expert advice via always possible's platform, The Possibility Club. Later phases will help entrepreneurs develop business plans and focus on growth. Find out more and register your interest here: https://lnkd.in/eDsDmEYV #growth #startups #mentoring Corinne Day Michelle Connors Mike Shorer Julia Johnson Duncan Kerr Emily Wright Joe Hill Penny Shimmin Nick Stockman
